com.opera.core.systems.runner.inprocess

Class OperaInProcessRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opera.core.systems.runner.AbstractOperaRunner
      • com.opera.core.systems.runner.inprocess.OperaInProcessRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OperaRunner

    public class OperaInProcessRunner
extends AbstractOperaRunner
implements OperaRunner
    OperaInProcessRunner provides a native Java in-process way of launching and managing Opera instances. It relies on Selenium's CommandLine.

      • stopOpera

        public void stopOpera()
               throws OperaRunnerException
        Description copied from interface: OperaRunner
        Stops Opera, does nothing if Opera isn't running. Typically we'll use the exec service to stop Opera, but this method will _ensure_ that Opera is quit from an external process controller.
        Specified by:
        stopOpera in interface OperaRunner
        Throws:
        OperaRunnerException - if runner has been shut down

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • captureScreen

        public ScreenCaptureReply captureScreen(long timeout)
        Description copied from interface: OperaRunner
        Take a screenshot of the full screen with a timeout.
        Specified by:
        captureScreen in interface OperaRunner
        Parameters:

        a reply with various information on the captured area

      • captureScreen

        public ScreenCaptureReply captureScreen(long timeout,
                               List<String> knownMD5s)
        Description copied from interface: OperaRunner
        Take a screenshot of the full screen with a timeout and a list of previously known MD5 hash sum results. If the screen capture matches one of the MD5 hash sums, the capture's image data will not be stored.
        Specified by:
        captureScreen in interface OperaRunner
        Parameters:
        timeout - attempt to take the screen capture until the timeout is reached
        knownMD5s - a list of hashes of known MD5's, causing no image data to be stored
        Returns:
        a reply with various information on the captured area
